Package org.codehaus.preon

The package providing the API allowing you to construct your own Codecs, and to extend the way Codecs are constructed.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Builder The interface to be implemented by objects with the capability to create default instances of arbitrary types being passed in.
Codec<T> The interface to be implemented by objects that are able to decode/encode objects.
CodecConstructionListener An interface implemented by some objects to notify listeners that new Codecs were created.
CodecDecorator A factory for Codec decorators.
CodecDescriptor  
CodecFactory A factory for Codecs.
CodecSelector The interface to be implemented by objects that have the capability to select a Codec based on data on the buffer and a context for resolving references.
CodecSelectorFactory A factory for creating CodecSelectors.
ExtendedCodec<T>  
Resolver A simple interface for resolving variable values.
ResolverContext A convenience interface, defining a ReferenceContext of Resolver.
 

Class Summary
Codecs A utility class, providing some convenience mechanisms for using and documenting Codecs.
DefaultBuilder The default implementation of the Builder interface, simply invoking Class.newInstance() on the class passed in.
DefaultCodecFactory The default CodecFactory implementation, constructing Codecs based on all CodecFactories available by default.
NullResolver A null implementation of the Resolver interface.
 

Enum Summary
CodecDescriptor.Adjective An enumeration with different adjectives.
Codecs.DocumentType An enumeration of potential documentation types.
 

Exception Summary
CodecConstructionException The exception thrown when a CodecFactory fails to construct a Codec.
CodecException The base exception class for any kind of problem that might occur while encoding/decoding.
DecodingException The exception thrown when the Codec fails to decode a value from the BitBuffer.
 

Package org.codehaus.preon Description

The package providing the API allowing you to construct your own Codecs, and to extend the way Codecs are constructed.

If all you want to do is basically use the default way Codecs are getting constructed, then the best place to start is the Codecs class. This class carries everything required to construct new Codecs, to use Codecs and to document Codecs.
